file_content.text: Nice bit of work you've pulled. We all owe you.
Better keep moving!
Hey--I'm hearing good news for a change. Thanks to you, the Killiks are finally backing down.
Not everything is smiles and sunshine, though. An Ulgo raiding party just hit one of our outposts further up the valley. Hard.
With old Bouris down for the count, his people must be looking to push through us and hit Castle Organa for some payback.
I'm surprised House Ulgo is still fighting without their leader.
The Ulgos are still active?
It's almost worse now--without anyone in charge, they're doing whatever nasty things they want. Our only shot is for you to stop them.
The Ulgos must figure they've got a shot at charging through us and hitting Castle Organa, now that the Killiks are in shambles.
Ulgo's raiders wouldn't make such a bold attack if they didn't have more plans to follow.
I believe you're right.
Exactly. This is the start of something we don't need, so I say we stop it.
The Ulgos' aggression is their weakness--if we strike back now, they won't see us coming.
We can stop them.
I was hoping you'd volunteer.
These raiders could just be the first wave of a much larger invasion.
We should be cautious.
All the more reason to stop them.
Shooting up a little camp is one thing. I doubt these jerks could make it past us and the Killiks.
This is no big deal.
Let's make sure of that.
I'm surprised anyone would expect a plan like that to work.
Ulgo must be desperate.
If you hadn't shown up, we'd be no match for them. You're our only shot at stopping these scumbags.
This sounds like guesswork, not facts.
You can't know for sure.
A pack of trigger-happy raiders yelling "Death to Organa!" and charging down the valley doesn't leave much room for interpretation.
Our contact in the camp that got hit, Jeren Organa, says the raiders have taken cover in a cave not far from their position.
Head up there and show Ulgo's raiders what we're made of. And see if you can grab any of their medpacs--Jeren's people could sure use them.
Once the Ulgo troops are dealt with, I'll take any medpacs I find to Jeren Organa's camp.
Got it.
You're a pro. Take care out there.
The attack would go better if you could spare some troops to help.
Can you back me up?
I'd like to, but Colonel Malcom doesn't want me giving up any manpower. This show's all yours.
I'm going to wipe this scum off the face of Alderaan.
Time for blood.
Won't hear any complaints from me.
I'll make sure Jeren knows to expect you at his camp. Good luck.
No time for talk now!
Colonel Malcom sent us to help. Are you Lieutenant Ross?
I've come to help--Colonel Malcom sent me. Are you Lieutenant Ross?
That's affirmative. Ignore the getup--colonel doesn't want us standing out.
Hope you've got an appetite for Killiks, because that's what's on the menu--probably ten of them for every one of us.
People here have plans to push the bugs back, but I need every gun we've got just to keep from being overrun. Think you can make those plans happen?
Just keep the Killiks back and we'll make sure they learn to stay away.
I'm on it.
Works for me.
The sooner we finish here, the sooner I can take you out.
[Flirt] Anything for a lady.
Really? This seems like the right time to fire me a pickup line? You're lucky you're useful, pal.
Do I look like someone who can't handle a few bugs?
You think I can't handle this?
No, you look like the best news I've seen all week.
If these plans aren't good, I'm walking.
I'd better be impressed.
Long as you take down a few hundred Killiks on your way out, fine by me.
My people will tell you what they have in mind. Good luck.
Not the time for conversation.
